channel.title: SQL error
channel.description:
Hello,
i'm working on an sql login, and I cant get rid of this dang error:
[code]Warning: session_start() [function.session-start]: Cannot send session cache limiter - headers already sent (output started at /home/sphinx/public_html/temp/test/login_success.php:3) in /home/sphinx/public_html/temp/test/login_success.php on line 4[/code]
My login_success.php code:
[code]// keep at top loul // lalalal <? session_start(); if(!session_is_registered(myusername)){ header("location:main_login.php"); } ?>
<html> <body> Login Successful </body> </html>[/code]
Anyone no what is wrong?
Thanks

item.title: SQL error
item.dc:creator: @Ian Ian
item.description:
@Ian wrote:

// keep at top loul // lalalal

this will be considered HTML, and since you are doing session_start() which sends a header, it will have been too late since your ‘HTML’ was already sent and with its HTTP headers… keep your comments inside the <? ?> tags so they are considered COMMENTS

Read full topic

item.title: SQL error
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“I james I, post:3, topic:243954”][quote author=ZeroFreeze link=topic=320306.msg2536228#msg2536228 date=1226761843]
remove the characters before the <?
[/quote]

Wow nice one. Thanks :P[/quote]Doesn’t it tell you on php.net to have it at the very top?

Read full topic
